perturbation.original_text: Choice of Law; Arbitration; Venue. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of California, USA, excluding conflict of laws provisions and excluding the 1980 United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. Any disputes arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the then-current commercial arbitration rules of the American Arbitration Association ("RULES"). The arbitration shall be conducted by one (1) arbitrator appointed in accordance with the Rules in San Francisco County, California. A judgment upon the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction of the parties, including without limitation the courts in San Francisco, California. The non-prevailing party in the arbitration shall pay all fees and charges of the American Arbitration Association; each party, however, shall be responsible for the payment of all fees and expenses connected with the presentation of its respective case.
perturbation.changed_text:
Independent Contractors. The parties are independent contractors with         respect to each other. Each party is not and shall not be deemed to be         an employee, agent, partner or legal representative of the other for any         purpose and shall not have any right, power or authority to create any         obligation or responsibility on behalf of the other.

Choice of Law; Arbitration; Venue. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of California, USA. Any disputes arising out of this Agreement may be resolved through arbitration if both parties agree. If arbitration is elected, the then-current commercial arbitration rules may be used. The arbitration shall be conducted by one (1) arbitrator. A judgment upon the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction of the parties, including without limitation the courts in San Francisco, California. The non-prevailing party in the arbitration shall pay all fees and charges of the American Arbitration Association; each party, however, shall be responsible for the payment of all fees and expenses connected with the presentation of its respective case.
perturbation.explanation: The original arbitration clause is moved to the Independent Contractors section to obscure it's intent. The language is also softened to say disputes 'may' be resolved through arbitration 'if both parties agree'. This introduces ambiguity and contradiction. The original clause mandates arbitration, while the modified version makes it optional, weakening its enforceability under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Arbitration Act, Federal Arbitration Act

perturbation.original_text: EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO         EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR         THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THE SOFTWARE EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT ACTUALLY         PAID BY CORIO HEREUNDER FOR THE TRANSACTION WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES         TO DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE         CAUSE OF ACTION TO WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY         ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER         PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS OR         COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES, OR FOR ANY         INDIRECT, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY         THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF         THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT THIS SECTION 9         REPRESENTS A REASONABLE ALLOCATION OF RISK.
perturbation.changed_text:
EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO         EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR         THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THE SOFTWARE EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT ACTUALLY         PAID BY CORIO HEREUNDER FOR THE TRANSACTION WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES         TO DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION TO WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY         ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS OR         COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES, OR FOR ANY         INDIRECT, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY         THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT THIS SECTION 9 REPRESENTS A REASONABLE ALLOCATION OF RISK. 

CONFIDENTIALITY.
Each party hereby agrees that it shall not use any Confidential Information received from the other party other than as expressly permitted under the terms of a non-disclosure agreement to be concurrently executed with this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original section 9, Limitation of Liability, is duplicated. This redundancy creates ambiguity regarding the intended limitation and could be interpreted as conflicting clauses, weakening the intended protection against extensive liability under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law Principles - Ambiguity and Interpretation

perturbation.original_text:
Software User License Agreements. Corio shall make the Software and the         MarketSite.net Service on the Corio Servers remotely accessible to         Customers under the then current terms of its end user license         agreement. As to each Software User who is provided access to the         Software, Corio

[*] Certain information on this page has been omitted and filed separately with     the Commission. Confidential treatment has been requested with respect to     the omitted portions.

4         shall secure the Software User's consent to an end user agreement, which         provides that the Software User may access and/or use the Software and         MarketSite.net Service only under terms and conditions which include, at         a minimum, those set forth on EXHIBIT E ("END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT")         and made a part hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Software User License Agreements. Corio shall make the Software and the MarketSite.net Service on the Corio Servers remotely accessible to Customers. As to each Software User who is provided access to the Software, Corio shall endeavor to secure the Software User's consent to an end user agreement, which provides that the Software User may access and/or use the Software and MarketSite.net Service under generic terms and conditions, which may be similar to those set forth on EXHIBIT E ("END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT").
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that Corio 'shall secure' end-user consent to specific terms in Exhibit E. This is replaced with 'shall endeavor to secure' with vague terms and conditions. This weakens consumer protection as the exact terms of the end-user license are not secured. This can weaken the agreement under California Consumer Rights laws.
